intro: Aria herefordensis, commonly known as the Herefordshire bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the UK. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, elongated seed capsules. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
